body.name: GAMDIAS Argus M1 Gaming E-ATX Mid-Tower PC Case, Left Tempered Glass with LED Strip on The Front, Sync MB, Black, (GD-Argus M1(EPE))
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 6 hrs 10 mins
features: Extremely Spacious Room For Your System: Supports up to 360mm/240mm/120 liquid cooling radiator on the front and top, up to 120mm of 6 fans and 350mm long graphics card, high CPU cooler up to 168 mm, additional 2.5" SSD trays at the back panel, and easy-access dust filters at the top.

Excellent Air Flow for Low Temperature: The Mid Tower ATX PC Case is allowed to upgrade for Top: 2 x 120mm, 2 x 140mm computer case fans; Front: 3 x 120mm, 2 x 140mm; Rear: 1 x 120mm for outstanding ventilation. With AIO coolers up to 360mm for the front and top, it's the best gaming case to keep your PC temperature low.

Innovative and Extraordinary Design: Gamdias Mid Tower Case with innovative front RGB lighting panel with mixed glossy and matte black design brings the gaming PC chassis market a different and elegant design choice and makes your system builds astonishing.

Great Expandability for Your System Config.: With 2 x 3.5” HDD bays or 2 x 2.5” HDD Cages/ 2x 2.5" Tray, USB3.0 x1, USB2.0 x2, and the LED button, the desktop pc case gives DIY builders ultimate flexibility to personalize their PC. Furthermore, it supports different mobo from EATX, ATX, Micro-ATX, Mini-ITX . 7 expansion slots allow you to fully utilize your motherboard’s expandability

Clean Design for Component Assembly: With the PSU Shroud Design and the Magnetic Dust Filter, the computer case doesn't only give a clean look for your systems but also makes the cable management easy and hasszle-free.
body.description: Gaming Computer Case for PC and Desktops, Made by GAMDIAS

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 234 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this case.
reviews.reviewText: This case is great. I was not expecting it to be such high quality, considering the low price. This case Is as good, if not better, than cases I have paid much more for. The tempered glass is really high-end glass. The case is really solid. The only thing to complain about, is it comes with zero instructions. You can find a downloadable manual online however. Not that is all that much of a help. This company makes a superb case, at a unbelievable price. They however, have taken the green move to heart, and save a lot of trees, with their zero manuals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very great looking case of high quality with 2 glass panels and RGB.
reviews.reviewText: This case is fantastic overall. It come with 2 fans that have no led and this provide more than adequate cooling for the configuration I use. There is no issue with cable management. There is plenty of room to install most extra coolers or graphic card and other add on devices. There is 2 RGB lights system one for the plug holes in the front panel and one for the strip. If your mother board does not support RGB you need to connect the RGB system to your PSU for the LEDs in the front panel to light up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Bang for Buck RGB case
reviews.reviewText: Great value for money and solid case overall. I did have an issue with the fans not being ARGB but GAMDIAS had no problem sending me the correct ones excellent customer service will be purchasing from them again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The case looks really nice but I wish the fans were ARGB instead of RGB, so they are stuck on rainbow. Also the picture shows that it has an open hole to show the power supply but I purchased two black ones and one white one, both black ones have no openings to show the power supply from the glass side. Can't complain for the price though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Well made, well packed mid-tower computer case. It will hold a motherboard up to an EATX size.I installed an mATX motherboard, an there was a LOT of room. This is pretty big for a mid-tower.Some of the other reviewers mentioned a dearth of stand-offs, but I found there to be plenty if you reused some of the pre-installed ones.The case I received had two pre-installed, non-lit fans (one front & one rear,) rather than a single RGB fan.The description mentioned the need for an ARGB motherboard, or an ARGB controller, for the front panel LED strip, but it turns out that all the front panel RGB effects have their own built-in controller: you only need an ARGB motherboard if you want to sync the front panel strip to the motherboard lighting. The RGB on the plugs & switches don't have a sync. connector. The case lighting has multiple options, as well as off.There are two removable drive trays that will hold either a 2½" or 3½" drive, and two more places to hard mount additional 2½" HDD/SSDs. There's no provision for an optical drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: molex is eh but its beautiful

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Budget Case
reviews.reviewText: My 2 main computers are a 3rd gen i7 (HP 8300) and a 6th gen i7 (Hp 800 G2), both with 32 gigs of RAM. I had a GTX 1060 in the 800 because my GTX 1070 wouldn't fit in the case and the Argus M1 solved this problem. Other than Minecraft (running 65 mods), both PCs do everything I need. I'm a casual gamer, so I don't need a high end gaming PC. I've been a Windows Insider since 2015 and Microsoft recently upgraded both to Windows 11, so now I'm planning to order a second case for the 8300 since both machines are good for another 10 or more years.I was pleasantly surprised with how solid the Argus M1 case is. For $50, I was expecting it to be about as sturdy as some extra heavy duty aluminum foil. I was equally surprised that it came with 2-120mm fans. Neither are illuminated, and neither have great air flow, but are still useful. Assembly took no more than 20 minutes (if that). I would highly recommend this case, and not just for a budget build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price but....
reviews.reviewText: compré este gabinete para una pc gamer de entrada, le puse una rx 6400 y no hubo mucho problema, diria que le cabe una rtx 3070 sin ningun problema pero es mejor invertir mas en otro gabinete, le pondria 5 estrellas pero paso algo muy raro, le faltaba el cable del boton reset, nunca habia visto algo asi, hasta me hizo gracia xD, lo bueno es que yo nunca he usado ese boton para ser sincero pero igual no le puedo poner 5 estrellas a un producto defectuoso, las temperaturas del pc son estables, asi que si vas a armar una pc de gama de entrada o gama baja, este gabinete te puede interesar

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this case being a bit weary since it has no reviews at all, probably not even been bought yet. I can gladly tell you that this case is fantastic, really bright RGB fans, powerful airflow and spacious. I’d also like to mention that it is well priced for what you get! Highly recommended - it also came with storage cables and a bunch of screws. I have attached a photo to show you it being powered!
